name: WAFByteMatchSetByteMatchTuples
description: ByteMatchTuples is a property of the AWS::WAF::ByteMatchSet resource that specifies settings for an AWS WAF ByteMatchSet resource, such as the bytes (typically a string that corresponds with ASCII characters) that you want AWS WAF to search for in web requests.

properties.name: FieldToMatch
properties.description: The part of a web request that you want AWS WAF to search, such as a specific header or a query string.

properties.name: PositionalConstraint
properties.description: How AWS WAF finds matches within the web request part in which you are searching. For valid values, see the PositionalConstraint content for the ByteMatchTuple data type in the AWS WAF API Reference.

properties.name: TargetString
properties.description: The value that AWS WAF searches for. AWS CloudFormation base64 encodes this value before sending it to AWS WAF.

properties.name: TargetStringBase64
properties.description: The base64-encoded value that AWS WAF searches for. AWS CloudFormation sends this value to AWS WAF without encoding it.

properties.name: TextTransformation
properties.description: Specifies how AWS WAF processes the target string value. Text transformations eliminate some of the unusual formatting that attackers use in web requests in an effort to bypass AWS WAF. If you specify a transformation, AWS WAF transforms the target string value before inspecting a web request for a match.
